definition: from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal

root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: I just wanted to write down everything the professor said and memorize it.
sentences.chinese: 我就是把教授讲的话原原本本纪录下来然后记住。

sentences.english: FY : Well, if there were, You would not tell me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你喜欢他，你也不会原原本本地告诉我了。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Huang Jizhong translates religion and Western culture contents almost word for word out.
sentences.chinese: 黄继忠将有关西方文化内容原原本本地翻译了出来。

sentences.english: To the unit, ground of my meaning from beginning to end Xiaoyao said to Rena .
sentences.chinese: 到单位，我把小姚的意思原原本本地对丽娜说了。

sentences.english: This model is seldom actually implemented as is.
sentences.chinese: 该模型实际上很少被原原本本地实现。

sentences.english: He gave a full account of what happened in the school yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他把昨天学校发生的事原原本本叙述了一遍。

sentences.english: She gave him a full account of her conversation with the doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她向他原原本本地转述了自己和医生的对话。

sentences.english: Evidently he expected to restore their old friendship at once and without modification.
sentences.chinese: 很显然，他是想立刻原原本本地恢复他们往日的交情。

sentences.english: Women want you to love them for exactly who they are.
sentences.chinese: 女人想要你爱原原本本的她。

sentences.english: He repeated the conversation word for word.
sentences.chinese: 他原原本本地复述了那段对话。

sentences.english: I told them the whole story exactly as it happened.; I told them everything down to the smallest detail.
sentences.chinese: 我把这件事原原本本讲给他们听了。

definition: lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
variant of 原原本本[yuan2 yuan2 ben3 ben3]
to pass on (stories)/to relate
lit. to put everything out including the tray/to reveal everything/to make a clean breast of it all
without missing a word
to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development
to add interest (to a story)/to sex up
the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
as things really are/realistic
see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
word for word/verbatim
the whole story
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
actual situation/truth
to pour beans out of a bamboo tube/to come clean/to make a clean breast of things
